Questions.QuestionString: cai khi taken bleed system in ENG low power:
which reseason  IP check valve in IP system:
tai sao lai co IPCV on bleed system:
Answers: supply IP air while HP air shutoff . khong chac
stable ENG power while ENG lower running

Questions.QuestionString: what is control of EBAS system:
Answers: ENG bleed air system, One BMC for each side
2 Bleed air application system ( BAS) and 2 Bleed air monitoring (BAM) application host in 2 BOMU

Questions.QuestionString: which valve can be lock-out:
which poisiton for X-Bleed valve when X-Bleed selector in auto position:
Answers: open when no  bleed avail or single ENG bleed air supply or bleed air supply by Ground cart or Bleed air supply by APU
close when both ENG supply Bleed air and APU bleed off or bleed leak detect.

Questions.QuestionString: HP ground cart supply symbol come in only ( chu GRT CRT mau trang):
Answers: A/C on ground ,No APU nor  ENG bleed air supply, P=20psi

Questions.QuestionString: The HPGC supply symbol (white GND and green triangle) comes into view in ENG BLEED page only when(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The A/C is on ground (input from LGERS) and there is no APU nor ENG bleed air supply
The bleed ducts are pressurized (pressure above 20 psi).

Questions.QuestionString: Nguon cap nao duoc su dung cho dieu khien nhiet do Bleed air
Answers: modulating  fan air flow( FAV) through fuel flow

Questions.QuestionString: which mode regulation follow for EBAS system
Answers: electrical mode or backup pnematic mode

Questions.QuestionString: what happen when bleed air leak detect
funtion of Overheat detect system (OHDS):
Answers: leak detect, leak isolation, leak repair
leak detection, leak isolation, leak location

Questions.QuestionString: Which valve can be de-activate:
Two Bleed Air System (BAS) applications:
Answers: Changeover after each flight or after failure

Questions.QuestionString: When the XBLEED selector is in the AUTO position, the cross bleed valve is automatically controlled by:
Answers: A Bleed Air System (BAS) application installed in CPIOM.
A Bleed Air Monitoring (BAM) application hosted in BOMU.

Questions.QuestionString: When all APU and ENGINEs bleed airs are available:
Answers: APU bleed having priority over engine bleed air.
APU bleed will supply bleed air only if the X BLEED selector is selected OPEN
Engine bleed have priority over APU bleed air.

Questions.QuestionString: At normal configuration, which valve ensures ENGINE BLEED system pressure regulation?
In case of overpressure ( the MPV does not operate correctly), the ENGINE BLEED system protection is ensured by:
Answers: Electronically by closure of HPV, MPV and overpressure shut-off valve .
In backup a pneumatic protection is done by the overpressure shut-off.

Questions.QuestionString: At normal configuration, which valve ensure ENGINE BLEED system temperature regulation:
The functions of the overheat detection system (OHDS) are:
Answers: Leak detection,  leak isolation and leak location

Questions.QuestionString: Two Bleed Air System (BAS) applications(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Changeover After each flight or after failure

Questions.QuestionString: The  cross bleed valve is(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Electrically controlled, operated independently by two electrical motors.
Electrically controlled, operated by one electrical motor.

Questions.QuestionString: When the XBLEED selector is in the AUTO position, it will be closed automatically in case(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Both Engine Bleed Air System (EBAS) are operative in normal configuration, without APU bleed air
Air is supplied from the HP ground cart

Questions.QuestionString: When all APU and ENGINEs bleed airs are available(A, B1, B2)
Answers: APU bleed having priority over engine bleed air.
APU bleed will supply bleed air only if the X BLEED selector is selected OPEN
APU bleed will supply bleed air only if the ENG BLEED pushbuttons are selected OFF

Questions.QuestionString: The HPGC supply symbol (white GND and green triangle) comes into view in ENG BLEED page only when(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The A/C is on ground (input from LGERS) and there is no APU nor ENG bleed air supply
he bleed ducts are pressurized (pressure above 20 psi).

Questions.QuestionString: Engine Bleed Air System (EBAS) is used for:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Bleed air pressure regulation (including HP/Intermediate Pressure (IP) transfer) and bleed air temperature regulation

Questions.QuestionString: Location of the Precooler (PCE)(A, B1, B2)
The fan air flow exiting the PCE is vented to(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The engine core zone and is subsequently vented overboard.

Questions.QuestionString: To replace the PCE need the dedicated tool(B1)
On the BLEED page which valve are not displayed(A, B1, B2)
When A/C inflight, at normal configuration, which valve ensure ENGINE BLEED system pressure regulation(B1, B2)
In case of overpressure ( the MPV does not operate correctly), the ENGINE BLEED system protection is ensured by(A,B1, B2)
Answers: Backup a pneumatic protection is done by the overpressure shut-off valve
Electrically controlled and pneumatically operated the  overpressure shut-off valve
Electrically controlled and pneumatically operated the  fan air valve

Questions.QuestionString: When A/C inflight, at normal configuration, which valve ensure ENGINE BLEED system temperature regulation(A, B1, B2)
The functions of the overheat detection system (OHDS) are:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Leak detection,  leak isolation and leak location
